title: AITA for telling my mom she's not good at being a mom?
self_text: I know, I know, it’s bad timing and I should have said something sooner but I just needed to vent. My mom is very loving and caring and has always been there for me. However, she is very disorganized and sometimes messes up things that are important to me. I once got into a fight with her because she didn’t buy the right kind of paint for my project (I was trying to make a painting and she bought blue when I wanted green). She apologized and even bought me new paints, which was sweet, but it made me feel like she doesn't pay attention to what I want or need. This isn't about the paint, it’s more about the fact that she often doesn’t listen to me or consider my feelings. I told her recently that she wasn't the best at being a mom and I was tired of feeling ignored and having to constantly correct her. Her reaction was really upsetting, saying “you think I am a bad mother?” I felt terrible and started crying. I tried to explain why I said it, but she just kept repeating how I was wrong and how hurtful I was to her. Then she threatened to stop talking to me if I continued to say such things. Now I don’t know what to do. I feel guilty and upset, but also still frustrated and hurt. I can’t help but feel like she needs to be a better mother. I love her so much but it’s hard for me to accept her flaws.  AITA?

title: A day in the life of a freshman at UCLA
self_text: So I wanted to share a bit about my experience as an incoming freshman at UCLA. This is gonna be really long, so please feel free to skip it.  First off, I am super excited for college and UCLA! It's been a dream of mine since I was little, so I'm trying to soak up all the new experiences. My parents were amazing and drove me here. We took a road trip and visited some cool places along the way. Now that I’m here, it’s a lot more overwhelming than I expected.  I live in a dorm with four other girls (including myself) and it’s crazy living with people you just met. The first few days were mostly awkward—we didn't know each other's names or anything. But now we are slowly starting to get to know each other.  My schedule is pretty packed, but I like it. Classes are hard, but challenging. The professors seem to be pretty nice too, though they're busy so you have to ask questions yourself if you don't understand something.  I can’t wait to explore LA and meet new people!  But honestly, I miss my family a lot already.  Anyways, I figured this might be helpful for anyone else who is nervous about going to college or even for people who are thinking about going to UCLA. Let me know if you have any questions!

title: I went to a party with my friends last night and met someone who was very attractive. They said they wanted to get together, but I told them I don't like that. Now they're saying it's not their fault for being attractive and that people should stop saying "you look great" because it makes them uncomfortable.  I know the difference between consent and asking for permission, so can you please explain what I did wrong?
self_text: Okay, let me lay out the situation. We were at a party and he started talking to me. He says he likes me, then tells me he wants to get together.  I told him straight up that I didn't want to get together, which is how most conversations go, right?  He said he doesn't understand why I can't say yes, and I said I just don't like him.  Then he says it's not his fault for being attractive.  I said something along the lines of "that's a weird thing to say."   Now he's sending me messages about it and saying it's not his fault for being attractive.  What am I doing wrong?

title: Can you guys help me with the following question?
self_text: I am trying to solve a problem in class and I am stuck on the last part. Here is the prompt:  You are given an array of integers, say A = \[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]. Find all pairs (i, j) such that i < j and A\[i] + A\[j] == 6. For example, A\[0] + A\[1] = 1+2=3 != 6, but A\[0] + A\[2] = 1+3=4 != 6, but A\[1]+A\[3]=2+4=6. So (1,3) is a valid pair.   My code is below. Please look over it and tell me if there's any errors.

title: Why is the sky blue?
self_text: This is a trick question! The sky is blue because of Rayleigh scattering, where shorter wavelengths of light are scattered more than longer ones. Blue has a shorter wavelength than red, so it’s scattered more. It’s like when you throw a small ball at a bunch of big balls, they will be bounced around by the smaller ball but the bigger ones won’t be affected.

title: I’m so tired of being a victim of the system, and I feel like no matter what I do it won't change anything.
self_text: I just want to be a good person and have a life. This is what they told me in middle school and high school and now college and even my job. It’s just constant negativity that makes me feel worthless. How can I get out of this cycle?

title: Did I get a bad grade?
self_text: Okay so I was studying for the last couple of days and felt really confident but I got a 58 on my quiz and I think I failed so here’s the problem, I didn’t study at all because it was just supposed to be an easy quiz and now that I know I failed I want to go back and review everything so I can do better next time.  Does anyone have any tips or advice?

title: How to remove a single white hair from my head?

It won’t come out with a comb or brush, and it keeps coming back no matter how many times I pull at it.  I have extremely fine, light brown hair so any time I try to pick it out, it ends up getting more tangled and pulling on the surrounding hairs.  Can anyone recommend an easy way to get rid of a single white hair that refuses to come out?!

title: The best way to start learning Python?
self_text: I just started coding a few months ago and have been using some basic tutorials, but they’ve never really clicked for me. They are always going over stuff that I already know and don't feel like I am actually making progress in my journey. I want to learn python more effectively, so do you guys have any recommendations on how to make it easier to learn or what should be the next step in the process?

self_text: I’m starting out with a new game and i want to get a good result for the first time. Can anyone give me some tips?

title: Is it okay to take a break from a long term relationship?
self_text: I’m not sure how to handle the situation.  I’ve been with my partner for about 5 years now and things have become stale recently. We still love each other but we just aren’t doing anything together anymore, which is fine, it’s more like there's nothing left to do or talk about.  We're both getting into our late twenties, so we're not kids anymore, we're trying to build lives together that don’t necessarily require constant contact and intimacy. So basically, we’re living separate lives and only interacting when necessary.  But, it feels like we are slowly drifting apart because of this lack of communication and effort. And honestly, it feels sad.  I know it’s probably not something that can be fixed, but I also feel like if I don’t address it soon, then we’ll continue going down a path where we end up in a very unhappy place.  So, I was wondering what people think and if it would be healthy to take a break from each other.  It feels bad saying this but I feel like I need space to figure out myself before committing to any further plans, especially since it doesn’t seem like we’re both on the same page.  And I don’t want to hurt him more than needed.  Do you guys think it would be helpful to take a break?

title: I’m a freshman and my roommate is making a huge mess and isn't doing anything about it
self_text: We have been living together for a month, and his room has been a disaster ever since we moved in. He leaves clothes on the floor, dirty dishes piled up, empty cans of soda and wrappers everywhere, etc. He never cleans and always says he will do it but doesn't.  I am starting to get really frustrated with him. Can anyone give me some advice?

title: I’m so glad you’re here.
self_text: I just wanted to say that it is really great to see you here! It is a joy and pleasure for me to be with you, as my friends. Thank you all for being here today and for believing in me!  I am looking forward to our future together. You are all amazing!
